meanings.definition: The act of emerging or coming out from something.
meanings.sent1: The emersion of the sun from behind the clouds brightened the sky.
meanings.sent2: The emersion of the turtle from its shell amazed the children.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved the emersion of a rabbit from the hat.
meanings.sent4: The emersion of new ideas in the meeting sparked creativity.
meanings.sent5: The emersion of the butterfly from its cocoon was a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: The process of becoming visible after being hidden or submerged.
meanings.sent1: The emersion of the submarine from the water surprised the spectators.
meanings.sent2: The emersion of the moon from behind the clouds lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The emersion of the treasure chest from the sand caused excitement among the beachcombers.
meanings.sent4: The emersion of the truth from the lies revealed the whole story.
meanings.sent5: The emersion of the star from the horizon marked the beginning of the night.
